Package controller

Class LibraryController

java.lang.Object
controller.LibraryController
public class LibraryController extends Object
The LibraryController class is responsible for managing the library's catalog and readers. It provides methods for registering readers, adding books to the catalog, displaying the catalog, searching for books, borrowing and returning books, and changing the language of the user interface. It also handles the persistence of data to files.

  • Constructor Summary

    LibraryController(Persistency persistency, View view)
    This class represents a controller for the library system, responsible for managing the communication between the view and the model.

  • Constructor Details

    • LibraryController

      public LibraryController(Persistency persistency, View view) throws ClassNotFoundException, IOException
      This class represents a controller for the library system, responsible for managing the communication between the view and the model. It initializes the persistency, view, catalog, and readers, and loads the data from the persistency on creation.
      Parameters:
      persistency - the persistency object used to load and save data
      view - the view object used to display information to the user
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - if the specified class cannot be found during deserialization
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during deserialization

  • Method Details

    • saveLibraryState

      public void saveLibraryState()
      Saves the current state of the library by persisting the books catalog and readers list to files.

    • loadData

      public void loadData() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Loads data from persistency and populates the catalog and readers list.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading from the file.
      ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found.

    • runLibraryController

      public void runLibraryController() throws FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Runs the Library Controller. Displays the menu and processes user commands until the exit flag is set to true.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found.
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • processCommand

      public void processCommand()
      Processes the user command by prompting for input and executing the corresponding action. The action is determined by the user input, which is matched against a set of predefined options. If the user input is not recognized, an error message is displayed.
